intro: Galium wendelboi, commonly known as the alpine bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium wendelboi thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its medicinal properties have been explored for their potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
